intro: Galium geminum, commonly known as twin-stemmed bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features opposite, slender, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. Its flowers are tiny, white or pale green, and are clustered in dense, whorled inflorescences. Galium geminum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
